fields.description:
Currently, when using the new issue view, it's not possible to add internal comments (JSD) or restrict comment to groups (JSW).
Please, add this feature to the new issue view.
fields.summary: Ability to add internal comments when using the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Resolved
The issue is now resolved and all users should be able to add comments properly now. If you still experience issues related to this, do raise a ticket to our Support.

h3. Summary
When adding a comment in an issue, the comment "spins" and it doesn't refresh to confirm that the comment is added. If the user refreshes the page, the comment is added properly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a Jira issue
# Add a comment


h3. Expected Results
* Comments get added properly and refreshes on the commenter's screen.

h3. Actual Results
* Comment "spins", the comment is already added but it doesn't refreshes on the commenter's screen.

h3. Workaround
* This doesn't happen in the New Jira Issue View(Jira Labs). Enable Jira Labs as a workaround.
* Refresh the page and the comment will be added.
fields.summary: Comments are not added and spinning

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 25 May 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Work is now underway to bring an attachments list view to Jira. The list view will reach Jira Service Desk in the next month and following this will be introduced for Jira Software and Jira Business.

Kind regards,

Atlassian
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, attachments are displayed as thumbnails in the New Issue View of Jira, as shown in the screenshot below:
 !_KAIS-1__Are_you_the_hunter____or_the_prey__-_Jira.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to select the "List" view for attachments, which is an option available in the Old Issue View:
 * !Screen Shot 2018-08-30 at 21.48.31.png|thumbnail!

h3. Why this is important

Anytime an issue in Jira has multiple attached files with long filenames, the current state is likely to pose a problem. Especially when many of those filenames start with the same substring of text. Since the new issue view doesn't guarantee to display the entire filename, it makes it very difficult to quickly see and understand which file is which. A thumbnail of the file is only ever useful to image attachments, whereas having a list view would be beneficial to seeing and sorting all attachments (regardless of type) by their actual filename.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Allow users to display attachments as a list in the New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Trying to use the copy+paste keyboard shortcut to change the Jira summary value on the Old Issue View does not work.

h3. Environment
* Windows 10
* IE 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ctrl + C a text
# got to a Jira issue. 
# select the summary field (title)
# try to Ctrl + V

h3. Expected Results
* The summary is updated. 

h3. Actual Results
* Nothing happens
 

h3.Workaround
* This does not happen on Google Chrome. Changing the browser can be considered a workaround. 
* Also, turning on the new issue view can be considered a workaround.
fields.summary: copy paste on summary field Ctrl + C / Ctrl + V shortcut is not working on IE and Firefox

fields.description:
In the new issue view, it's not possible to sort comments, history or worklogs.
 It would be great if we have the option to choose the order of the activities.

 
h3. Workaround

You can disable [the new issue view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/the-new-jira-issue-view-938040503.html] by either:
 * Going to your personal settings in Jira: [https://NAME.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa|https://name.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa] and disable the new UI at all:
!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/79462i91DCCFC71F667D63/image-dimensions/302x214?v=1.0|width=302,height=214!
 * Adding *?oldIssueView=true* to the url when opening an issue for which you would like to see the attachments section. For example: [https://NAME.atlassian.net/browse/ABC-123?oldIssueView=true|https://name.atlassian.net/browse/ABC-123?oldIssueView=true]
fields.summary: Ability to sort activities when using the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The New Atlassian editor, which is used in the New Issue view, automatically adds a backslash \ when the text "pr" and "pu" is added to either comments or description of issues.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue using the New Issue View.
 # Add a comment with ":pr" or ":pu".
 !_KAIS-2__Daughter_of_the_Void_-_Jira.png!

h3. Expected Results

The exact text typed will be added as a comment.
h3. Actual Results

The New Atlassian Editor automatically adds a backslash \ before the colon, as shown in the screenshot below:

!_KAIS-2__Daughter_of_the_Void_-_Jira-2.png!
h3. Workaround

Disable the New Issue View on the personal settings' page Labs section.
fields.summary: The New Issue View adds a backslash when typing a certain combination of characters

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* uploading attachments that exceeds the limit size from the *backlog page view* and from the *issue page* is throwing different error messages. 
* The first error: "We couldn't save your attachment. Reload the issue then try adding it again" is actually misleading. 
** !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
* The second error helps to identify that the issue is specifically related to attachment size: "File exceeds maximum size limit set by the administrator (10.00 MB)."

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to upload attachment from the backlog page view (with a size exceeding the limit defined through > System > Advanced > Attachments)
# Try to upload attachment from the Jira issue view

h3. Expected Results
* Error "File exceeds maximum size limit set by the administrator (10.00 MB)." thrown in both cases. 

h3. Actual Results
* A misleading error "We couldn't save your attachment. Reload the issue then try adding it again" is thrown. asking to reload the page as a fix of the issue (which is actually not the case)
fields.summary: Misleading error related to attachment size

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* As an administrator I want an easier way to identify when a component lead is an inactive user. 
* Currently, I need to check the list of users through *site administration*, then verify if an inactive user is set as component lead through the *components* page.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Similarly to inactive assignee, we suggest to add the word *inactive* between parenthesis to the component lead who is set as inactive. 

h3. Why this is important
* Component lead receives a notification when the component is set to an issue. When the component lead is inactive, losing track of the component is considered a risk. 
* Identifying inactive component lead through the components page makes administering this feature easier.
fields.summary: More easily identify inactive Component Lead

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing an issue that has a security level set in the new issue view, the security level system field is not displayed.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue and set a security level  for that issue
# View the issue in the new issue view.

h3. Expected Results

The Security level is displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The Security level is not displayed.


h3.Workaround
Use the old issue view.
fields.summary: Jira New Issue view does not display the Security Level of an issue.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, integrating Jira Cloud and Bitbucket will show some development-related fields in the _View Issue_ screen of Jira (Branches, pull requests etc.). These fields, together with fields added by different add-ons and integrations (like _Slack Messages_) cannot be arranged like an ordinary field by editing the _view issue_ screen

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability for Jira Administrator to re-arrange these fields just like any other field in the screen
fields.summary: provide the ability to re-order fields created by add-ons and devtools

fields.description:
When writing comments on a ticket in the WYSIWYG editor, I often have a link already on my clipboard, and when inserting a link with Cmd+K the link part of the template `[Text|Link]`, [http://www.example.com|http://www.example.com/] is inserted.

 

I suggest that if there is a linkable URL in the clipboard, paste that link into the link part of the template instead.
fields.summary: Autocomplete link from clipboard with Cmd/Ctrl+K

fields.description:
In the old view, it's possible only to click on *...* on the sub-task directly from the sub-tasks' field and change the status.
In the new issue view, we have to open the task and change the status the same as any ticket.
It would be great if we could change the status easily as it was before.
fields.summary: Ability to change the sub-task status in the new issue view the same it was on the old view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, for "Two Dimensional Filter Statistics" gadget, there's no option to select "Organization" field.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the organization field for one of the selection.
fields.summary: Add "Organization" field for "Two Dimensional Filter Statistics" gadget

fields.description:
{panel:title=Product Update - Dec 20th, 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#add8e6|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone, I am happy to share with you that we have rolled out the ability to configure the field layout on the new issue view! This is available to all customers who have the new issue view enabled. You can find more information here: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configure-field-layout-in-the-issue-view-961798059.html|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configure-field-layout-in-the-issue-view-961798059.html] 

Here are a couple of key points about this you should know. More detailed info is in the docs link above.
 * This only applies to classic projects that are using the new issue view. Next-gen project types already have the ability to add/remove/edit the field ordering of the issue view. See [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/working-with-next-gen-software-projects-945104895.html] 
 * The new Issue Layout option in your project settings is what allows you to order your fields. It still gets the list of available fields from your global screen config that is being applied to the specific issue type you are editing within that project. If you change the ordering this will *only* affect the field layout for those issue types within that specific project. The new Issue Layout option is *not* a global setting. It is a per project setting.
 * Only project admins and site admins have access to this Issue Layout option. It can be accessed by clicking on the ... within any issue detail view. Or go to your project settings.

If you have any questions, or would like to see some improvements, there is a feedback collector on the Issue Layout edit page. So give us your feedback, we are looking to iterate and improve this moving forward but we are excited about this change. We hope it makes using the new issue view much more enjoyable!

Taylor Pechacek, Jira Cloud - Sr. PM

 
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Previously in the old view, the list of the field in view issue screen follow the sequence in Screen configuration.
h3. Suggested Solution

The field follow the order as per configured in Screen configuration.
h3. Why this is important

The admin intended to order the field, but now the field display not in order.
fields.summary: In the new view , the list of field should follow the order as in Screen configuration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the "Configure Field" feature will set for any screen. For example , if it set at "Create Issue" screen for certain project and issue type , the configuration will be the same for others too. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide option to set the "Configure field" based on project/issue type.

h3. Why this is important
Make the interface more user friendly. The user don't need to change it everytime they create a different issue.
fields.summary: Ability to set "Configure Field" feature in screen based on Issue Type

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when using the {{/user}} endpoint and getting a deleted user object the JSON returned only indicates that the user is inacive:
{noformat:none|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
https://<instance>.net/rest/api/2/user?username=<username>
{noformat}

Response:
{noformat:none|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
accountId: -
key: -
name: - 
emailAddress: -
active: False
{noformat}

The only way to confirm whether the user is really inactive or was deleted is by searching him through the UI.

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement a new attribute for the user object that will indicate whether this user was deleted or not.

h3. Why is this important

Users that have integration with other systems may try to reactivate these users not knowing they were deleted and thus face problems.
fields.summary: JIRA user rest API object doesn't have a distinction from deleted/inactive

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue in Jira Software(ex. SS-30)
# Create an email with the followings:
## To: jira@instance.atlassian.net, or any other mail handler configured to "Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue"
## Title: SS-30　test

h3. Expected Results
A comment will be added to SS-30

h3. Actual Results
A new issue will be created with summary: <issue key-created-on-step1>　test
 
h3.Workaround
Avoid using double-bytes in the title
fields.summary: Mail Handler not adding comments to existing issues when the mail title includes tab

fields.description:
Please add back the ability for each user to disable the new issue view for themselves.

This new issue view feature is not ready to become the default view for users. It is missing a number of features, missing fields, and missing functionality that our organization depends on.

We need to be able to turn it off until it is actually ready for use.
fields.summary: Need ability to disable new issue view for business projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating a new version on the date fields if you chose to move the month to the next one Jira is skipping the next month

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the create version pop up menu
# On the fields date open the calendar menu
# Using the arrows on the top right corner of the calendar try to change to the next month
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-29 at 16.45.52.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The month will be changed to the next month

h3. Actual Results
The day is changed to the last day of the current month but the month does not change and if you try to use the arrow again it will skip the following month

h3.Workaround
Go back one month allows you to go to the following month of the current month without issues.
fields.summary: Date picker for release date is skipping the following month

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 25 May 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Work is now underway to bring an attachments list view to Jira. The list view of attachments will be useful when browsing Jira issues with many attachments and we believe will alleviate the problems experienced navigating attachments with the "<" and ">" buttons.

Kind regards,

Atlassian
{panel}
Currently, we have to click on a ">" and "<" to check attachments when there are more than 4-5 files on a ticket.
 It would be great if we have an option to expand and collapse the field and show/hide all attachments.
fields.summary: Ability to expand Attachments field in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Changing SD portal announcement permission configuration causes null pointer exception in the audit log


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Jira Settings -> Applications -> Jira Service desk configuration 
# Change the value from "Can agents add announcements to the help center?" (to any value)
# Check the audit log

h3. Expected Results
Display the audit log

h3. Actual Results
A Null pointer exception is thrown with a stacktrace.

!image-2018-08-29-11-42-38-567.png|thumbnail!


h3.Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: Changing SD portal announcement permission configuration causes null pointer exception in the audit log
In new Jira Issue View turn "Tabs" into collapsible groupings on side bar

fields.description:
It would be wonderful if the Gadget Type could be changed at the Edit.  All I want to do here is look at the data in a different way for the same exact filters.  

I have run into this several times over the years

[https://brierley.atlassian.net/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=28105] was copied to make [https://brierley.atlassian.net/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=28107]

Instead all have to be removed and readded with teh same filter.

Please consider this suggestion.
fields.summary: Ability to Change the Gadget Type Upon Edit of Dashboards Jira

fields.description:
Currently, admins will be able to create application link for 3rd party applications to generate an OAuth token for REST API access. Explained on the documentation below:

* https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-rest-api-oauth-authentication/

However, it lacks the ability to show the resource owner (the person that configured the application link). Hence, it is subjected to:

# Not able to audit and contact the owner
# In case of admin that configured that link left the organization, it will fail the application link and it takes time to identify

It would be great if we can show the resource owner for the Generic Application's application link
fields.summary: Ability to View the Resource Owner for the Application Link

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment search results cannot be sorted by Issue Links
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the search results to be sorted by Issue Links in issue navigator
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Why this is important


It would make it easier to find Issue Links in ASC/DESC order
fields.summary: Allow Search Results To Be Sorted By Issue Links In Issue Navigator

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the old issue view, a user can switch the issue type from the view screen provided that the destination issue type uses the same workflow. 

 !view screen.png|thumbnail! 

This is not possible in the new Jira issue view.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the switching of issue types in the new Jira issue view.

h3. Workaround 

Use the *Three Dot Menu > Move* option to switch issue types within the same project.
fields.summary: Add the ability to switch issue types on the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Issue collector is requesting username as a mandatory field which is contradictory to our announcement that the username is deprecated. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# choose a project
# Try to create an issue collector 
# The *Reporter* field is mandatory
#* you cannot set the email address as a reporter. 
#* you have to choose username 

h3. Expected Results
* Username is supposedly deprecated. 
* Full name or email address is supposed to be a valid input to the reporter field. 
* Moreover, having the *Browse users and groups* global permission, I'm supposed to see the list of options when writing the reporter name (similarly to the behavior of the field assignee in the Issue view) but nothing shows up. 

h3. Actual Results
* Only the username is accepted. 

h3.Workaround
* You can get the username by hovering-over the full name of the user in the site administration section.
fields.summary: Issue collector is requesting username as a mandatory field.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If the jira.permission.create.clone is set on a status of a workflow with any value, a 500 error is thrown when viewing an issue on that status. Users can't add comments, attachments and create sub-tasks.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project.
 # Add the jira.permission.create.clone with the value "disable" to a status.
 # Publish the workflow.
 # Go to a issue using the New Issue View to try to add a comment.

h3. Expected Results

Users are able to add comments, attachments and cloning issues is disabled on that status as a result of the property.
h3. Actual Results

The following 500 error is thrown in the console:
{code:java}
Unknown type 'clone' in meta attribute 'jira.permission.create.clone'. Valid permission types are defined in permission-types.xml{code}
Users aren't able to add comments or attachments and create sub-tasks because the options are not available, as shown in the screenshot below:
 !QID_board_-_Agile_Board_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! !_QID-1__Workflow_Property_Test_-_Jira.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Remove the property from the workflow.
fields.summary: jira.permission.create.clone workflow property disables comments, subtasks and attachments in the New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence pages linked to a Jira issue in the 'mentioned in' section is not visible in the [new Jira issue view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/the-new-jira-issue-view-938040503.html]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link a Jira issue in a Confluence page
# Verify that the 'mentioned in' section appears in the old view {{?oldIssueView=true}}

h3. Expected Results
Confluence pages visible under the Issue links section

h3. Actual Results
Confluence pages not visible under the Issue links section
 
h3. Notes
This only affects the new issue view 

h3.Workaround
Use the old issue view by disabling 'New Jira issue view for software projects' under Jira lab features in the Personal Settings page
fields.summary: 'mentioned in' section missing in the new Jira issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, issues that are in Done *category* columns on a board are hidden after 14 days of inactivity, and business board have a limit of 1000 issues that can be displayed. If the number of closed issues is a lot bigger than the number of open issues, after issues are removed from the board, other closed issues can be displayed instead of open issues.
h3. Suggested Solution

Change the board rules so that when issues are set as inactive and removed from the board, issues that are not on a Closed status are prioritized over closed issues. Issues with a more recent created date should be the ones displayed.
h3. Why this is important

This makes so users who have a lot of issues in a project are still able to use the business board, as currently, it might not suffice anymore since newly created issues won't be displayed.
h3. Workaround

Create a software board based on a filter to use instead of the business board.
fields.summary: Prioritize new issues over closed ones on Business Boards after inactive issues are hidden

fields.description:
Currently, when changing the opsbar-sequence in the workflow, the order of the workflow buttons only reflects on the old view.

In the new issue view, it shows only the same sequence, for example, To Do - In Progress - Done, even though the opsbar-sequence is correctly configured to show a different order of the buttons.

It would be great if the changes also reflects in the new issue view.
fields.summary: Opsbar-sequence changes does not reflect on new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * Trying to import a Trello board to a Jira site with Jira SW product activated is interrupted with an IllegalStateException error thrown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Search for a Trello board that has at least one card mapped to a different member rather than the admin.
 # On your Jira site ensure that you have Jira software (not only Jira Core) > go to External System Import > Trello importer.

h3. Expected Results
 * Trello board is imported successfully to a Jira project.

h3. Actual Results
 * The import process is interrupted with the following error: Unexpected failure occurred. Importer will stop immediately. Data may be in an unstable state: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Project configuration id does not match project roles configuration id: Project configuration id does not match project roles configuration id

h3. Notes
 * This only affects cloud sites that has Jira software activated since the import will be to an Agility project.
 * When trying to reproduce this behavior, ensure to map the Trello card to a different user who is not the admin. 

h3. Workaround
 * Import the board to a test site that has only Jira core activated then csv export to the Jira production site.
fields.summary: Importing Trello board with assignee other than the admin causes IllegalStateException error

fields.description:
The new Issue View is currently displaying and supporting the add-on's fields and modules only for the Agility and the Software projects, but not for the Core/Business projects. 

This is a problem as there is no workaround from the user's end to disable this feature for Business project. Users have to click the link *use the old view* on every Business ticket to access the add-on's fields.

Software: add-on's fields available
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-28 at 10.26.13.png|thumbnail! 

Agility: add-on's fields available
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-28 at 10.24.36.png|thumbnail! 

Business: add-on's fields not available
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-28 at 10.25.50.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: New Issue View is not supporting/displaying the add-ons modules and fields in Business/Core projects

fields.description: It would be handy to be able to customize *Jira time tracking reports* to show actual dates (due) rather than the amount of time (hours, days etc) remaining. This will provide a better and more accurate idea of time remaining.
fields.summary: Allow customization of fields in time tracking reports to display actual dates

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The search feature is showing an error message in Mozilla Firefox

h3. Environment
* Mozilla Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
It happens when you quickly press 'enter' after typing the search before the suggested issues are loaded. But the issue won't be replicable if you let the issues to load.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
No error message

h3. Actual Results
"System Error" error message is showing

h3.Workaround
Use a different browser, i.e Chrome or Safari
fields.summary: Error message on the search

fields.description:
I run the Presence service, which Jira calls *a lot*.
We have noticed a large spike in errors around each of redeploys (which is at least weekly, sometimes more frequently).

Basically, Jira continues to call the old Presence stack right up until Micros terminates it. Some context to the investigation is shown in [this Datadog notebook|https://app.datadoghq.com/notebook/48612/Presence%202018-08-13%20Investigation].

There are two likely fixes that could be applied in Jira here:

1) Fix the duration of the DNS caching performed by the JVM: See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sdk-for-java/v1/developer-guide/java-dg-jvm-ttl.html
2) Ensure your HTTP client is expiring connections periodically. Here’s an example of how we do that with Apache HTTP client in one of our services: https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/pf-emoji-service/commits/83f3abaa6ec1d274b6713b14cc4a4f9891b9714e#chg-src/main/java/com/atlassian/product/fabric/emoji/Application.java

Confluence have observed the same problem in the past: https://product-fabric.atlassian.net/browse/FS-1913

Note, this particular problem will be solved if/when we switch the Presence service to use Application ELBs which is tracked as https://product-fabric.atlassian.net/browse/FS-2950. However, since you most likely have other external HTTP dependencies that are also seeing this problem it is probably still worth addressing in Jira.
fields.summary: Jira continues to call against an undeployed Presence stack right up until the stack is terminated therefore causing spikes in errors both in the service and to Jira

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When the Workflow Pie Chat doesn't have any data to display, i.e. fields have a NULL value, then the Workflow Pie Chart will throw a generic "An internal server error occurred when requesting resource ." error message.

||Filter Results|| Gadget Configuration||
|   !Screen Shot 2018-08-27 at 9.45.35 PM.png|thumbnail!   |  !Screen Shot 2018-08-27 at 9.35.26 PM.png|thumbnail!|

h3. Suggested Solution
* Instead of a generic error message, display something like what is shown here:
!no-data.png|thumbnail! 
* Display a more descriptive message based on the response to the request:
{noformat}
{"errorMessages":["It seems there is no work logged for these issues. I can only generate this report if there is work logged."],"errors":[]}
{noformat}

h3. Why this is important
* "An internal server error occurred when requesting resource ." isn't very informative or helpful to the end user as it doesn't give any real insight into what is happening
* Gives the end user enough information to troubleshoot the issue themselves without having to learn how to interpret the information in the browser Developer Tools
* The gadget will appear more polished/professional

h3. Workaround 
* Open the browser development tools(instructions vary depending on browser) and open the "Network" tab
* Try configure and save the Workload Pie Chat configuration
* There should be a request with a status=500
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-27 at 9.38.36 PM.png|thumbnail! 
*  In the "Response" or "Preview" tab, you'll see a more detailed error message e.g. 
{noformat}
{"errorMessages":["It seems there is no work logged for these issues. I can only generate this report if there is work logged."],"errors":[]}
{noformat}
fields.summary: Workflow Pie Chart: lack of a meaningful error message

fields.description:
We have Epics that are repeated and whose stories cross sprints.  We would like to be able to duplicate the stories when we duplicate the Epic (similar to the option to copy sub-tasks when we duplicate stories). 

An example use case:  Releases - We follow specific steps that are replicated for each release:  Implementation Planning, Regression Testing, Rehearsal, User Testing, etc. 

Since we deploy monthly, you can see how painful and time-consuming this becomes, plus it makes it easier to forget a step if we are building or replicating them one at a time.
fields.summary: Provide an Option to Copy Stories when Duplicating Epics

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Jira won't save changes when selecting a GMT Offset time zone.

Instead, it displays the following error message:
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-27 at 15.13.30.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Click on the icon profile -> *Personal settings*;
# Select GMT Offset - any, in the *Your timezone* options;
# Save changes.

h3. Expected Results

The changes will be saved.

h3. Actual Results

There is an error message and the changes are not saved.

h3. Notes

There is a similar bug, but with different timezones. https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71480

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Can't set any GMT Offset time zone

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 11 Nov 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for contacting us about the new Jira issue view.

In redesigning the issue view, we're working on simplifying it to make key information easier to find and to streamline everyday tasks.

Unrelated to the new issue experience, as a company, Atlassian has decided to enter into a strategic partnership with Slack and discontinue the HipChat and Stride products. You can read more about that announcement [here|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/announcements/new-atlassian-slack-partnership]. As a result, we will *not* add support for HipChat and Stride to the new issue view.

To stay up-to-date with what's happening with the new issue view, watch our documentation [page,|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog] which we update when we add new features and functionality.

Cheers,
 Eric
{panel}
Problem Definition
 Currently, the new JIRA issue view that is applicable to the full issue view page and board detail view of issues is not displaying the HipChat discussions as it was in the old layout

Suggested Solution
 Add support for this field so it can be shown in the issue details and full view.

Workaround
 Disable the new JIRA issue view under the Labs section inside the user profile or use the *?oldIssueView=true* at the end of the URL for business and Agility not affected by JIRA lab .
fields.summary: add support for hipchat in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to perform a backup to server or cloud in Jira cloud instances the backup process is getting stuck or failing with the following message:
{code:none}
Export error
Cannot get export task progress status (error)
Please try again later or contact support if error persists.
{code}

h3. Environment
Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start a backup for server on a cloud instance

h3. Expected Results
The backup will complete and a link to the ZIP file will be placed on the backup page

h3. Actual Results
The backup process fails with the following message on the UI:
{noformat}
Export error
Cannot get export task progress status (error)
Please try again later or contact support if error persists.
{noformat}
 
The following error message can be found on the logs:
{noformat}
message: Could not finalize export task with Zipper
msg: response.getLastHeader(HttpHeaders.CONTENT_LENGTH) must not be null	
stack: java.lang.RuntimeException: response.getLastHeader(HttpHeaders.CONTENT_LENGTH) must not be null
{noformat}
fields.summary: Jira Cloud Backup stuck or failing

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
Select List (cascading) custom field isn't showing on new issue view

h3. *Steps to replicate*
# Create or assign an existing Select List (cascading) custom field to a screen
# Create a new issue and select a value for the Select List (cascading) field 
# View the issue on the *new issue view*

h3. *Expected Result*
Select List (cascading) field visible on the new issue view

h3. *Actual Result*
Select List (cascading) field is missing on the new issue view:
 !Screen Shot on 2018-08-27 at 11.52.15 AM.png|thumbnail! 
Field exists on the old Issue View:
 !Screen Shot on 2018-08-27 at 11.50.12 AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Select List (cascading) custom field isn't showing on new issue view

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 25 May 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Work is currently in progress to improve the utility of the attachment cards in Jira. As part of these changes the uploaded date and time will be displayed. We expect these changes to be delivered to you in the next month.

Note that in addition to improved attachment cards we are also actively working on bringing a list view to Jira's new issue view. This will provide an alternative way for you to find your attachments and will also include the attachment upload date/time: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-70146

Kind regards,

Atlassian
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 10 Dec 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi Everyone,

I want to provide a quick update for this topic. this feature will be in progress soon, *show timestamp on attachments*, and it is being under consideration to be prioritised in the next couple of months. we will keep you posted with the updates. I know this has taken a while to build out, but rebuilding Jira issues is no small feat, so we very much appreciate your patience on this.

In the meantime, you can opt out of this new issue experience via your *Personal Settings* > *Jira Labs section* will have a 'new issue view' toggle to turn it on or off. We will not be disabling this opt-out option until we have rebuilt all the key features of the Jira issues experience you have come to know and love.

Regards,

Atlassian
{panel}

When searching tickets through Issues and Filters, if a ticket has attachments, it shows the date and time that the ticket was attached.

On the new issue view, it only shows the attachment's name when we put the mouse over the attachment.

It would be great if the new issue view shows the same information as the old view.
fields.summary: Show timestamp on attachments when using the new issue view

fields.description: Currently, the Regular Expression Check validator on Jira does not support the priority field and that makes impossible to set a validator based on the priority field.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Error when setting timezone to GMT Offset in the new personal settings


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to your personal settings
# Edit your timezone to GMT Offset
# Choose any offset and try to save
# ERROR: Couldn't save your preferences, something went wrong. Try again.

h3. Expected Results
The timezone is saved

h3. Actual Results
Cannot saveb the timezone when choosing GMT Offset
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround

Use cURL to update the timezone. You can also use the browser console to do this.

# Browse to https://<domain_name>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa.
# Activate the browser developer console and navigate to the 'network' tab.
# Attempt a change to the GMT Offset timezone. You will receive an error message and the error will be reflected in the network tab.
# Locate the end point that is returning 400 error : https://<domain_name>.atlassian.net/rest/internal/2/user/preferences
# Copy as fetch as shown in the screenshot below : 
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
# Paste it on the developer console.  You will see something like this :
{noformat}
fetch("https://<domain_name>.atlassian.net/rest/internal/2/user/preferences", {"credentials":"include","headers":{"accept":"application/json,text/javascript,*/*","accept-language":"en-US,en;q=0.9","content-type":"application/json"},"referrer":"https://<domain_name>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa","referrerPolicy":"no-referrer-when-downgrade","body":"{\"timezone\":\"GMT Offset/GMT+12\",\"locale\":\"en_US\",\"notify\":false,\"userNotificationsMimeType\":\"html\"}","method":"POST","mode":"cors"});
{noformat}
Modify the following :
{noformat}
"body":"{\"timezone\":\"GMT Offset/GMT+12\",\"locale\":\"\",\"notify\":true,\"userNotificationsMimeType\":\"html\"}"
{noformat} 
To :
{noformat}
"body":"{\"timezone\":\"Etc/GMT+12\",\"locale\":\"\",\"notify\":true,\"userNotificationsMimeType\":\"html\"}"
{noformat} 
The main idea is to change the 'GMT Offset' to 'Etc'. Do make sure that the method is set to POST as well.
# Enter to execute the fetch request. The change will be administered.
fields.summary: Error when setting timezone to GMT Offset in the new personal settings

h3. Problem Definition
As per [Advanced workflow configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/advanced-workflow-configuration-776636620.html#Advancedworkflowconfiguration-postfunctions] currently is not possible to set default values for a field on a transition.
If a custom field of the kind select list or radio button with a default value is placed on a transition the default value is being set to NONE instead of the default value.

Make the transitions accept the default value of fields such as in the issue creation.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the new issue view, the formatting should not be displayed if the field is using the Default Text Renderer

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have the new Jira issue view enabled.
# Configure a field (i.e. Description) to use the *Default Text Renderer* instead of *Wiki Style Renderer*
# Start typing on the field.

h3. Expected Results
If the field is using the default text renderer, the formatting box should not be visible, neither should apply any formatting.

h3. Actual Results
While the field is being edited, the formatting like bullet points or bold/italic is automatically applied.
 !field-edit.png|thumbnail! 

Once you save the changes, the field appears without formatting (which is expected)
 !issue-view.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
In the old issue view, if the field is using the Default Text Renderer, the formatting bar is not there:
 !old-issue-view.png|thumbnail! 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: In the new issue view, the formatting bar is visible even if the field is using the Default Text Renderer
Add possibility to disable public access to JIRA

fields.description:
Step to reproduce:

# Define a specific context for a required custom field such as a specific issue type as applicable context (let say bug)
# Create a project using having at least a compatible issue type to the one defined in the custom field applicable context (let say Task and Story)
# Create a Task or a Story
# Update the task issue type value to a bug using the edit issue screen.

Expected result:
Either the custom field should be added to the issue as we are now in its applicable context 
Either the bug shouldn't be available as compatible issue type 

Actual result:
you can update to the Bug and the custom field is not added according to its applicable context. More generally after the issue creation the context won't be updated 

The same happen editing the issue from a bug to a task for example, the required field in the context of a bug is still required for the Task after changing the issue type value. The context of the custom field is not updated.
fields.summary: editing/updating of the issue type is not updating the field's contexts accordingly

fields.description:
h2. Problem Description

When there is an error during uploading of an attachment, the pop-up error message box shows jira.attachments.not.uploaded.title instead of human-readable error message. See the sample below:

!Screen Shot 2018-08-23 at 9.53.19 PM.png|thumbnail!

h2. Steps to Replicate

# Upload a file that exceeded the file size permitted on the instance (10MB)
# Wait for the progress bar to complete
# Error pop up

h2. Expected Behavior

To have a human-readable error message title, such as *Attachments Exceeds Maximum Size Configured*. Or alternatively, something generic, such as *Attachments Failed to Upload Successfully*

h2. Actual Behavior

The error message title is displayed as *jira.attachments.not.uploaded.title*

h2. Note

This does not affect the latest issue view (that is still on labs) on Agile boards, it will print the following message instead:
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-23 at 9.50.47 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Upload Attachment Error Message Shows jira.attachments.not.uploaded.title

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When searching for issues, if the "Column View" is selected and the priority column is added, it only shows the Priority Icon instead of its name.

h3. Suggested Solution
Show the priority name instead of the icon.

h3. Why this is important
It's easier to understand the priority of the issue if the priority name is shown instead of the icon.
 
h3. Workaround 
Hovering the priority icon shows up its name.
(Optional)
fields.summary: Show the priority name instead of its icon in the "Column View"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When signing up at Atlassian, users will enter their full name into a single text field.

 !image-2018-08-23-13-14-20-500.png|thumbnail!

But some users get confused and type their last name first.

h3. Suggested Solution
Two separate text fields

# First Name
# Last Name

h3. Why this is important
The user will know the correct order to write their name 
 
h3. Workaround 
Tell user to update name at *id.atlassian.com*
fields.summary: Have two separate text fields (First-name & Last-name) instead of Full-Name when signing up at id.atlassian.com

fields.description:
Hello,

I'm managing a team of 10 people with Jira Core developing consultancy projects. Depending on client's needs I need to see in a kanban board all tasks of all projects in colums (as it can be seen in a board visualization for a single project. Colums=task status). Also it would be useful to have this view filtering by assignee. I would like to drag tasks of all the projects in one column (i.e.: to do) upwards or downwards depending on the priority (that varies from day to day). After I'm done defining priorities, people could work with their kanban board, focusing in only one task and dragging tasks to other columns in order to change the status.

I know that I can do this in a sort of way with filters, but is not as agile and good user-experience as it could be.

Thanks in advance
fields.summary: KANBAN BOARD FOR ALL PROJECT TASKS AND ASSIGNEES

fields.description:
When viewing an issue in the new issue view, it is no longer possible to edit an issue using the edit screen.

Given that fields that do not have a value do not show up, this means that it will not be possible to set values that are otherwise not available to change on transitions, nor is it possible to set those fields without performing a transition.

I would like to suggest offering the edit screen as an option in the transition menu, also allowing the option to block the inline edit in the new issue view.
fields.summary: Unable to edit issue with edit issue screen from new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
During the migration to the new Jira experience, some customers may have found a modal where it's possible to opt-in to the new experience or to postpone it. Such feature is described here:
- https://atlassian.design/guidelines/product/patterns/user-value-modals

h3. Suggested Solution
The solution would be similar to the *announcement banner* which is currently unavailable in the new Jira experience: Provide a way to create customized pop-ups or spotlights where users can be informed about certain information that needs to be acknowledged.
Such functionality could be customized in a way that the pop-up/spotlight appears only once to each user, or every time the user logs in.

h3. Why this is important
As the announcement banner is not available in the new Jira experience, such option would be a suitable workaround to admins communicate with users.

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Provide a way to create customised spotlight/pop-ups to communicate with users

fields.description:
h2. Problem Description

When the Default Application Access has nothing set in the User Management's Application Access page.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
Creating a new user through REST API still grants access to users created
That was due an entry exist at the {{licenserolesdefault}} table

Running
{noformat}
select * from licenserolesdefault
{noformat}
Returns
||id||license_role_name||
|10000 |jira-software |

(i) There could be multiple ways causing the entry to be populated, below is one of the tested possibility

h2. Steps to Replicate

# On Jira Server instance, set default application access to grant new users created to Jira Software application, generate a backup
#* Validate that the entities.xml contains {{<LicenseRoleDefault id="10000" licenseRoleName="jira-software"/>}}
# Import to Jira Cloud instance
# After completed the import, check the database entry, it should contain the entry
# Try creating a user using the REST API [User Creation Endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/#api-api-2-user-post]

h2. Expected behavior

It should respect the configuration on the user management instead of a leftover entry from Jira Server and creates a user without default group granted to the user

h2. Actual Behavior

It creates the user and grants the user with the groups configured as default groups for the application Jira Software.

h2. Workaround

* Remove the entry from the database with the help from support for Jira Cloud instances
* Remove the line {{<LicenseRoleDefault id="10000" licenseRoleName="jira-software"/>}} before importing

h2. Note

It will not affect *invite users* feature from user management; as using the invite user function, you will need to tick the application to grant to the user.
fields.summary: Importing from Jira Server retains the Default Application Access on Jira Cloud

fields.summary: Allow autocomplete to find search with "contains" instead of "starts with"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira does not trigger the 'Issue Commented' event when the email reply has an attachment included.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a notification scheme where the *Issue Updated* does not trigger any notification.
In this notification scheme, keep the *Issue Commented* event to fire notifications for the *Current Assignee*, *All Watchers* and *Reporter*, as default.
# Create a project and use this notification scheme.
# Reply to an existing issue through email - This reply must have an attachment included.
# Check the issue to confirm that a comment was created.

h3. Expected Results
Jira should trigger the *Issue Commented* event, and fire the notification to the recipients.

h3. Actual Results
Jira will trigger the *Issue Updated* event.

 
h3. Notes
- This problem seems to be a variant of JRACLOUD-41226
- These tests were done using the default mail server and the *Comments from emails* which is the default Jira mail handler.
- If the email has an image in the signature, that would count as an attachment.

h3.Workaround
Edit the notification scheme to include the recipients in the *Issue Updated* event.
fields.summary: Comments from email with attachments trigger the 'Issue Updated' event instead of 'Issue Commented' event

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when creating sub-tasks in the Issue Detail view, you only need to add a Summary, as shown in the screenshot below:
* !KAIS_board_-_Agile_Board_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

Because of that, if a user wants to also add an assignee or a description when creating the sub-task, the user will need to go to the sub-task link to do so.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to have the option to choose if the creation screen is shown when creating a sub-task in the Issue Detail View, even if there's no required field.

h3. Why this is important

This will give the option to customers who create a lot of sub-tasks to fill in all the fields without opening it in a new tab and without changing the field configuration for sub-tasks. Better UX for customers. 

h3. Workaround 
* Disable the New Issue View in the Personal Settings Labs' section by flipping the switch:
*  !Personal_Settings_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 
* Add a required field to the Create Issue screen.
fields.summary: Allow the Create Issue screen to be shown when creating sub-tasks in the Detail Issue View

fields.description:
The current Application Links documentation for Cloud is lacking to mention that application links (Generic Application) are being used to authorize REST API calls and that, in this case, the user who authorizes the request token (in the authentication process for the client) is used to make requests to Jira Cloud:
 - [Using AppLinks to link to other applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/using-applinks-to-link-to-other-applications-779295829.html]

 

The information about using Application Links to authenticate REST API calls is instead available in the below documentation pages:
 - [OAuth authentication for Jira REST APIs|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-rest-api-oauth-authentication/]
{quote}*OAuth for REST APIs*

This page shows you how to authenticate clients against the Jira REST API using OAuth (1.0a). We’ll explain how OAuth works with Jira, and walk you through an example of how to use OAuth to authenticate a Java application (consumer) against the Jira (resource) REST API for a user (resource owner).
{quote}
 - [Security overview|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/security-overview/]
{quote}
h3. Authorization for REST API requests

Authorization for direct calls to the Jira Cloud REST APIs is based on the user used in the authentication process:
|| || ||
|OAuth|The user who authorizes the request token, in the authentication process for the client, is used to make requests to Jira Cloud.|
{quote}

Please add a section to the existing documentation in order to have this explicitly stated since it causes some confusion.
fields.summary: It should be explicitly mentioned that application links can also used to authenticate incoming REST API calls for 3rd party Software integrations

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

The page resizing takes some time when there is a big disparity of amount of information between tabs.

In this example, the *Comments* tab has a big amount of info, but in the other hand, the *History* has only two entries:
 [^Resizing.mp4]

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue;
 # Add comments with a big amount of characters (in this case, I have 4 comments with 1843 characters each, and one with 7402 characters being displayed);
 # Make sure the there are just a few entries in the history (in this case, I had cloned the issue, so there was basically the issue creation record, and the issue link record);
 # When you are viewing the comment, switch to the *History* tab;
 # In this case, it took 6 seconds to resize. It gets worse as there are bigger comments being displayed (not hidden as old comments). Here's another example, with even bigger comments:  [^Resizing 3.mp4]   (9 seconds)

*Obs:* this can be reproduced the other way around as well (when there is a much bugger amount of information in the history, and just a few rows in the comments).

h3. Expected Results

The resize will occur normally.
h3. Actual Results

The resize does not seem optimised, causing a slow animation when resizing the page.

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Window resizing speed when there is a big disparity between the content of different tabs

fields.description:
On the [Server to Cloud migration page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/migrating-from-jira-cloud-to-server-applications-776636236.html] under Step 3, it says that during step 2 of the Jira Server installation process that the user will be prompted to "Import your existing data". However, when following the evaluation setup process for Server, the closest option "Import from another tool" is on the step immediately after licensing and setting avatar and language, which then offers tools for importing from specific other products as well as using CSV and JSON.
 !image-2018-08-21-10-59-36-249.png|width=600!

I would suggest updating this to say: choose "Create a new project" and then select "Import a project" from the lower left of the overlay.

!image-2018-08-21-11-13-02-800.png|width=600!

Then, from the left sidebar, they can optionally choose "Project import" or "Restore system", depending on what they want to do.

 -------

Another note: under Step 3 there's an info box that says, "You may see a message like the following" and then a broken img link.
fields.summary: Cloud to Server migration process incorrect

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It would be useful for the reports section to remember the last custom/date range. It currently remembers it within the same section like _custom_, but as soon as you move from a custom report to team or any other section, upon returning to a custom report the date range has reset to 7 days.

Also after viewing another menu or screen they also reset to 7 days,

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# View a custom JSD report and change the date range from the default
# View a report from another section like team or view an issue or another page
# Go back to the reports menu and notice all custom reports have defaulted back to 7 days

h3. Expected Results
Reports will always use the previously set date range

h3. Actual Results
It always defaults back to 7 days date range
 
h3. Notes
Either the ability to set a default or have persistent memory even after closing the tab would be good.

h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Remember the last date setting used when viewing custom reports or provide a default option

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Workflow's post function *Update Issue Custom Field* adds user wrongly to User Picker (multi user) custom field, if the username was previously associated to another account.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Add a user with following details:
#* Email address: *user1@example.com*
#* Username: *user1*
#* Full name: *Test User1*
# Update the user's details for the user above to the following details:
#* Email address: *user2@example.com* (this could be done through [Atlassian Account|https://id.atlassian.com])
#* Username: *user2* (this is not possible at the moment due to [Say goodbye to usernames in Atlassian Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/06/say-goodbye-to-usernames-in-atlassian-cloud], but might be done previously)
#* Full name: *Test User2* (this could be done through [Atlassian Account|https://id.atlassian.com])
# Add a new user with following details:
#* Email address: *user1@example.com*
#* Username: *user1*
#* Full name: *Test User1*
# Create a User Picker (multi user) custom field.
# Add the field to project's screens
# Edit the project's workflow and a *Update Issue Custom Field* post function to a transition with following details:
#* Issue Custom Field: choose the custom field added in step #4
#* Custom Field Value: add *user1* which refers to the user that is added in step #3
# Publish the workflow
# Create a new issue (or use an existing issue), and transition it through the transition for which the post function is added (step #6)

h3. Expected results
*Test User1* (user1@example.com) user is added to the User Picker (multi user) custom field

h3. Actual results
*Test User2* (user2@example.com) user will be added to the User Picker (multi user) custom field

(!) Note:
Based on issue history post function will be adding *Test User2* with email address *user2@example.com* and username *user1* to the custom field.

h3. Workaround
Please contact [Atlassian Support Team|https://support.atlassian.com/]!
fields.summary: Workflow's post function adds wrong user to field
Allow custom field positioning on issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
*Environment* field is missing in "new Jira issue view", even though it has been added to the screen and has a value. If you switch to the old view, the field appears in the issue.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Ensure the *Environment* filed is _visible_ in project's field configuration
# Add the field to *View issue* screen, and also to *Edit issue* screen if you wish to give the field value
# Create a new issue
# Edit the issue and add a value to *Environment* field
# Access the issue in *new Jira issue view*

h3. Expected results
The *Environment* field is visible in the issue page (*new Jira issue view*)

h3. Actual results
The field is missing in *new Jira issue view*

h3. Workarounds
Select *See the old view* at top-right in issue page to see the issue in old view. Or, disable *New Jira issue view* in your profile see all issues in the old view.
fields.summary: Environment Field is not visible in the "new Jira issue view", despite being added to the screen and having value

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When an app's web panel content reached a point where you need to scroll it, it's not possible for New Issue page/glance. See screenshot

*Steps to reproduce*
# Install any app that allows adding content to the Glance module, e.g. [Issue Checklist|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213231/issue-checklist?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]
# Open New Issue View page/dialog and next open the app Glance panel
# Add as much content as necessary to overfill the vertical space (e.g., add many checklist items in case of Issue Checklist app).
# Notice that you cannot scroll the glance panel even if its content does not fit into the page.
fields.summary: App's Issue Glance does not scroll in New Issue View

fields.description:
We have noticed a spike in the number of Russian users reporting having no connection to their Jira instance from their LTE network on their phones (some have said that it works fine on wifi or VPN). We believe this is due to the RKN blocking large chunks of AWS and other cloud providers.

In the Jira Android and Jira iOS apps this has become a major issue with users seeing no connection banners and not being able to use the apps. 

All the info is here regarding to blacklisted domains can be found here: [https://eais.rkn.gov.ru/en/]
fields.summary: Some IP addresses are being blocked by Russias RKN

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The *Created vs Resolved* gadget will retrieve the statistics of issues created or resolved within a certain timeframe.
However, this gadget is not relevant when you want to consider all the issues from a specific filter, as some issues may be outside the defined timeframe.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option where you can compare created and resolved issues without considering a timeframe.

h3. Why this is important
The gadget can provide some relevant information, but depending on the customer's needs, the results may not be the expected.
 
h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Improve the search criteria of Created vs Resolved gadget

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

It is currently not possible to have a validator where a transition is only possible after the issue has been in a status for a certain period of time. This can be useful for time sensitive situations (for example, escalating an incident to a developer after it has not been worked on for some time)

h3. Suggested Solution

Have a transition validator that only allows transitions once an issue has been in a certain status for a period of time
fields.summary: Have a transition validator based on time spent in status

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Currently, it is possible to use a Web link in the issue linking feature.

But differently from the Jira issue option, the Web link option does not have relational options to determine how the issue relates to the link:
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-17 at 10.32.25.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Suggestion*

Add those relational options to the Web link option.
fields.summary: Add relational options to a Web link (issue linking feature)

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Currently, in order to use the link feature, it is necessary follow the path:
* Ellipses button -> *Link*.

Then, you'll be able to click on the plus sign next to the linked issues field in order to add additional links instead of following the path mentioned previously.

h3. *Suggestion*

Have the link issue feature present in the screen by default, preventing the need of following the current path.
fields.summary: Have the link issue feature present in the issue view screen as default

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When uploading an attachment during issue creation, just before the attachment fully uploaded, cancel it and try creating the issue. The error below is thrown and prevents users from creating the issue.
*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On the Create Issue screen, upload an attachment, preferably 10MB or more in size. (So that it takes some time to upload, and we will have time to cancel it)
# Before the upload bar progress finishes, click on the (x) to cancel the upload progress.
# Continue to create the issue.
# Error below is thrown:
#*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* The upload should be fully canceled and the user should be able to create the issue.

h3. Actual Results
* The upload progress is preventing users from creating the issue.

h3. Workaround
* Close the Create Issue screen, and create the issue again.
fields.summary: Cancelling an attachment upload prevents user from creating issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
 *Atlassian Update, May 24th, 2019:*

Hello,

Thank you for sharing the issue. This issue is fixed in Jira cloud. Now, if you click on '<' icon to change the month, the date time picker shows previous month.

Thanks,
Jira cloud product management team
 
{panel}


h3. Summary

In 'Releases' page, when create a new version.
Clicking on the date time picker. When navigate to previous months, gets to two months before rather than the previous month

Or in Releases page, when Editing a version that does not have date set. The issue will occur
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Releases page
 # Create version
 # Click on date/time picker
 # Click on <

h3. Expected Results

It will show previous month dates
h3. Actual Results

Shows 2 month before dates
h3. Workaround

Just proceed to the proper month to choose the intended date and month.
fields.summary: Calendar in create/edit version screen goes 2 months back rather than only 1 month

fields.description:
Hello support,

 

we are running Jira Cloud with many customers. We can't provide them the permission "browse user" because of data protections reasons.

 

Because of this they cant @mention each other in projects we are working together. This is a big problem for us. Is there a fix for this?
fields.summary: "Browser User" Permission for Projects
Web Items with location: "transitions-all" are not displayed in the New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Changing sprint of the story from Backlog view does not show the issue on the sprint after updating it

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Open up the Backlog view of a Scrum project
# Click on a card in the *Backlog* (not in a Sprint)
# Use Quick Actions (ie, press . ) to get into the *Edit* screen
# Change the story's Sprint to an Active Sprint.
# Press Save

h3. Expected Result

The screen is refreshed and the story is displayed on the related sprint


h3. Actual Result

The backlog view is displayed but the ticket remains visible under the *Backlog* section

 [^Screen Recording 2018-08-15 at 07.03 PM.mov] 



h3. Workaround

* Manually refresh the page
* Disable Issue Details View (lab feature) from User Profile.
fields.summary: Changing sprint of the story from Backlog view does not show the issue on the sprint after updating it

h3. Summary

When the preferred language chosen in personal settings is set as Korean language.
Clicking on 'Edit configuration' in System Settings > General Configuration will result in a 500 error.
h3. Customer Impact

Impacts Administrators that uses Korean as preferred language in personal settings.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Click on the avatar on bottom left

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* As a Jira user, I'm trying to convert a subtask to a Task or a story for example as I used to do in the past.
* Currently, when I access my Jira issue, I have the new issue view experience. 
* I cannot find the *convert to issue* feature neither by clicking on the three dots from the right nor anywhere else. 
* I need to disable the new view to convert the issue. 

h3. Expected Results
* We are expecting to see the log work on the new Jira issue view as we used to do in the past: 
**  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* The *convert to issue* feature is not shown up: 
**  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!  

h3.Workaround
* Accessing the Jira issue using the search view feature can be considered a temporary workaround.  

h3. Update
* This bug is also applied to the opposite. When we are working on an issue, it's not possible to "Convert to Sub-Task" and "Create Sub-Task.
fields.summary: New Full View Issue Experience eliminates convert subtask to issue feature

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Adding an issue key from the new issue view editor does not create a link to the issue. The issue key is rendered as text only.

Also, the previously added issue keys are just rendered as links without showing any information about the issue (like it was before)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # From the old issue view add an issue key to a comment or to the description, see that is rendered nicely and displays information about the linked issue
 !01-Old-issue-view-editor-results-in-nice-links.jpg|thumbnail!
 # Switch on the new issue view. Add the same issue key to a comment (or description)
 !02-adding-link-new-issueView.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The issue key is rendered as a link
h3. Actual Results

The issue key is rendered as text only. Also, the previously added issue keys are displayed as links but are not displaying any information about the linked issue:
 !03-adding-link-new-issueView-RESULT.jpg|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

Switching back to the old issue view still shows the last added issue key as text only
 !04-switching-to-old-view-still-text.jpg|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Disable the new issue view
fields.summary: Issue keys are not rendered as links when added  from the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using Mobile and trying to add/update the billing details, the Billing Details form is not responsive, not able to scroll, pinch(zoom in or out). 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a browser using mobile
# Navigate to https://instance_name.atlassian.net/admin/billing.
# Select *Desktop version*.
# Add or update the billing details.
# The page is unable to scroll, or pinch(zoom in or out). Making it impossible to update the billing details. Fields like the Expiry date for the card information, user can't scroll it too, making it impossible to select November(11) or December(12).
#*  !Date field on mobile.jpg|thumbnail! 
# Tested with *iOS mobile with Safari browser* and *Android mobile with Chrome browser*

h3. Expected Results
* The Billing details form should work like any other page in Jira.

h3. Actual Results
* The Billing details form is not responsive to user input.
fields.summary: Billing Details on Mobile version is not responsive

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update—25 May 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

We can now confirm that we have begun working on a download all attachments feature for the new issue view. This will first be released to Jira Service Desk in the coming weeks followed by Jira Software & Jira Business in the coming months.

Kind regards,

Atlassian
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update—14 February 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your patience on this particular issue. We can now confirm that we have begun investigating the download all feature in the new issue view and have started reaching out to users to gather insights. We anticipate that development will begin in the next four weeks and we will regularly update this issue as we progress.

Regards,

Atlassian
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update—13 January 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi Everyone,

I want to provide a quick update for this topic. this feature will be in progress soon, and it is being under consideration to be prioritised in the next couple of months. we will keep you posted with the updates. I know this has taken a while to build out, but rebuilding Jira issues is no small feat, so we very much appreciate your patience on this.

In the meantime, you can opt out of this new issue experience via your *Personal Settings* > *Jira Labs section* will have a 'new issue view' toggle to turn it on or off. We will not be disabling this opt-out option until we have rebuilt all the key features of the Jira issues experience you have come to know and love.

Regards,

Atlassian
{panel}
h3. Summary

In the new JIRA issue view, there's no option to manage and download all attachments.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a few attachments to an issue
 # See the Attachments panel in the new issue view

h3. Expected Behavior

There should be an option to manage and download all attachments as in the old issue view
 !oldview.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Behavior

No such option exists
 !newview.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Use direct links:
 # Download All
{code:java}
https://<JIRA_Domain>/secure/attachmentzip/<Issue_ID>.zip{code}

 # Manage _(Download All is available on this page)_
{code:java}
https://<JIRA_Domain>/secure/ManageAttachments.jspa?id=<Issue_ID>{code}

(+) To get issue ID in the new view:
 * Click the {{...}} button on the top right side
 * Hover the mouse onto Clone or Delete
 * See issue ID from browser's status bar
fields.summary: Ability to Manage and Download All Attachments in New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira administrator is not able to access the Project Settings.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access JIRA Admin Panel > Projects
# Access a project (on which you are not under the people tab yet)

h3. Expected Results
In case you have a JIRA Service Desk license you should be able to access the project configuration and add yourself to the project

h3. Actual Results
You receive a message error saying: "This project isn't available"

h3.Workaround
Ask a user that already has access to the project to add the user under the people tab with the Role JSD Team.
fields.summary: Jira dministrator is not able to access Projects

fields.description:
Users would greatly benefit from being able to sort issues using multiple factors/columns. JIRA Cloud could allow the user to have three tiers of column sorting, each tier unable to disengage the effect of the the tier above but nonetheless applying it's own sorting.

In order to select which tier is currently editable, the user could give input via 'radio' buttons, drop-down lists, or any other practical UI element; defaulting to first tier.

Then the user could simply click a column to sort all issues in any list by the column, just as they do now. Say they choose Component for example. They've now found all the issues with, say, a component called "audio in a list also showing issues in other components; perfect.

But now they want to quickly and efficiently get an idea of how many of the 47 audio issues are in each priority level. Currently the user has to use a gadget in the dashboard to visualize the priority distribution of the audio related issues. But they would only need to take another couple seconds to click tier 2 and the priority column; no need to switch away from that page and waste small amounts of valuable time that add-up.

With the tier sorting feature, these users will not only be able to have quickly made a visual representation of the their 47 audio issues by priority, but they can also then quickly move to other components already organized by priority by simply scrolling down. A part of this optional feature is configurable headers before the start of the next first-tier sorting field; a relatively thin bar between the last and first issue of (in this case) each component with the total issue count under that first tier category/field/column.  

But when they scroll down, they see there are 2467 video component issues. But they know about the one-click refined search feature too! So they simply click the name of the component they want to refine their search with (either using the header or the component name on any issue's row), and JIRA will load up a search that now shows issues with the video component, and remembers your column sorting from a moment ago.

What an incredible help this would be for all of us. Thank you all for your hard work putting together this awesome database system that is JIRA. :)
fields.summary: [New Feature] Issue Sorting - Increase practicality/efficiency of issue searching by sorting with multiple columns & one-click refined searches
